us.thetaco.banana.sql

Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.thetaco.banana.sql.DatabaseManager

  • public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for handling all to do with the SQL-lite database. MySQL is a possibility, but for now SQL-lite is the best option
    Author:
    activates

        Adds an entry to be updating upon the next loop
        Parameters:

      • populateDatabase

        public boolean populateDatabase()
        Used to get the database ready for work!
        Returns:
        Will return true if the database was sucessfully populated!

      • syncLoadValues

        public boolean syncLoadValues()
        Used to load all of the stored information into the active cache (should only be used once!) Done in a sync thread.
        Returns:
        Will return true if the operation was sucessful

      • asyncAddBan

        public void asyncAddBan(java.lang.String uuid,
                        java.lang.Enum<DatabaseManager.BannerType> type,
                        java.lang.String bannerUUID,
                        java.lang.String message,
                        boolean tempBanned,
                        java.lang.Long tempBanDate,
                        java.lang.String unparsedDate)
        Used to add a player who has been banned. This will be added to a queue which will be ran once it's ready
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid to ban
        message - The message to ban! Cannot be null, must be some value
        tempBanned - If the player is being tempbanned or not
        tempBanDate - If the player is being tempBanned, a long version of the date (in milliseconds) must be provided

      • asyncRemoveBan

        public void asyncRemoveBan(java.lang.String uuid)
        Used to delete a ban in the database. It will be added to a queue which will be ran once it's ready
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid to unban

        Parameters:

        warnMessage - The message that went along with the warning!

        public void logCommand(java.lang.Enum<CommandType> commandType,
                       java.util.UUID senderUUID,
                       java.lang.String[] args,
                       boolean isConsole)
        Used to log a command a player ran! Only really useful for commands inside of BANana
        Parameters:
        commandName - The name of the command to log
        senderUUID - The sender of the command
        args - The arguments of the command.. Once again for logging purposes

      • asyncBanIP

        public void asyncBanIP(java.lang.String address,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.Enum<DatabaseManager.BannerType> type,
                       java.lang.String bannerUUID,
                       boolean tempBanned,
                       java.lang.Long tempBanDate,
                       java.lang.String unparsedDate)
        Used to add async add an IP ban to the database
        Parameters:
        address - The address to ban (wildcards might be supported D:)
        message - The message to go with the ban (optional)
        tempBanned - Set to true if this is a tempban
        tempBanDate - If tempBanned is set to true, you must give the date of the unban

      • asyncUpdatePlayer

        public void asyncUpdatePlayer(java.lang.String uuid,
                              java.lang.String address,
                              java.lang.String playerName)
        Used to async update the player's information in the database. This method will also update the local cache of the player's username
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid of the player
        address - The player's ip address
        playerName - the player's latest username

      • asyncRemoveIPBan

        public void asyncRemoveIPBan(java.lang.String address)
        Used to async unban an ip
        Parameters:
        address - The IP to unban

      • asyncAddMute

        public void asyncAddMute(java.lang.String uuid,
                         java.lang.String reason,
                         boolean tempMuted,
                         java.lang.Long unmuteDate,
                         java.lang.String unparsedMuteDate)
        Used to add a mute to the database (both temp and perm)
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid to mute
        reason - The reason used alongside the mute
        tempMuted - If the player is temp muted or not
        unmuteDate - The date that the player will be unmuted
        unparsedMuteDate - The pure form of the date (in the form 0:0:0:0 or similar). This iw only for pushing the updates to the servers outside the network

      • asyncRemoveMute

        public void asyncRemoveMute(java.lang.String uuid)
        Used to async remove mutes from the database
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid to remove (will remove all mutes on that specific UUID

        Parameters:

      • asyncPurgeWarnings

        public void asyncPurgeWarnings(java.lang.String uuid)

        Parameters:

      • kickAllUpdatePublisher

        public void kickAllUpdatePublisher(java.lang.String kickerName,
                                   java.lang.String message)
        Sends the update to kick all players to the database. If the other servers read this, they will kick all the players on that server, too.
        Parameters:
        kickerName - The name of the player who is kicking all the other players. (Not a UUID!)
        message - The message to kick the players with! Simple, right? No..? screw you!
